member.summary: Registers for a new capability on the client side. Not all clients need to support dynamic capability registration. A client opts in via the ClientCapabilities.dynamicRegistration property.

member.summary: Unregisters a previously registered capability.

member.summary: Diagnostics notification are sent from the server to the client to signal results of validation runs.
member.param: The URI for which diagnostic information is reported.
An array of diagnostic information items. To clear the existing diagnostics, pass instead of null.

member.summary: The telemetry notification is sent from the server to the client to ask the client to log a telemetry event.

member.summary: The telemetry notification is sent from the server to the client to ask the client to log a telemetry event.
member.param: Any number of data to be sent.

member.name: M:LanguageServer.Contracts.Client.IWindow.ShowMessage(LanguageServer.Contracts.MessageType,System.String)
member.summary: The show message notification is sent from a server to a client to ask the client to display a particular message in the user interface.
member.param: The message type.
The actual message.

member.name: M:LanguageServer.Contracts.Client.IWindow.ShowMessage(LanguageServer.Contracts.MessageType,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{LanguageServer.Contracts.IMessageActionItem})
member.summary: The show message request is sent from a server to a client to ask the client to display a particular message in the user interface. In addition to the show message notification the request allows to pass actions and to wait for an answer from the client.
member.param: The message type.
The actual message.
The message action items to present.

member.name: M:LanguageServer.Contracts.Client.IWindow.ShowMessage(LanguageServer.Contracts.MessageType,System.String,LanguageServer.Contracts.MessageActionItem[])
member.summary: The show message request is sent from a server to a client to ask the client to display a particular message in the user interface. In addition to the show message notification the request allows to pass actions and to wait for an answer from the client.
member.param: The message type.
The actual message.
The message action items to present.

member.name: M:LanguageServer.Contracts.Client.IWindow.LogMessage(LanguageServer.Contracts.MessageType,System.String)
member.summary: The log message notification is sent from the server to the client to ask the client to log a particular message.
member.param: The message type.
The actual message.

member.name: M:LanguageServer.Contracts.Client.IWindow.ReportWorkDoneProgress(LanguageServer.Contracts.ProgressToken,LanguageServer.Contracts.WorkDoneProgress)
member.summary: Report any kind of progress including work done progress (usually used to report progress in the user interface using a progress bar) and partial result progress to support streaming of results. (LSP 3.15, $/progress)
member.param: The progress token provided by the client or server.
The progress data.
member.remarks: Progress is reported against a token. The token is different than the request ID which allows to report progress out of band and also for notification.

member.name: M:LanguageServer.Contracts.Client.IWorkspace.ApplyEdit(LanguageServer.Contracts.WorkspaceEdit)
member.summary: Modifies resource on the client side.
member.param: The edits to apply.
member.returns: Indicates whether the edit was applied or not.

member.name: M:LanguageServer.Contracts.Client.IWorkspace.Configuration(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{LanguageServer.Contracts.ConfigurationItem})
member.summary: Fetch configuration settings from the client. The request can fetch several configuration settings in one roundtrip. (LSP 3.6)
member.returns: The order of the returned configuration settings correspond to the order of the passed (e.g. the first item in the response is the result for the first configuration item in the params). If a scope URI is provided the client should return the setting scoped to the provided resource. If the client for example uses EditorConfig to manage its settings the configuration should be returned for the passed resource URI. If the client can’t provide a configuration setting for a given scope then null need to be present in the returned array.
member.remarks: The configuration section ask for is defined by the server and doesn’t necessarily need to correspond to the configuration store used be the client. So a server might ask for a configuration cpp.formatterOptions but the client stores the configuration in a XML store layout differently. It is up to the client to do the necessary conversion.

member.name: T:LanguageServer.Contracts.CodeActionKind
member.summary: The kind of a code action. Kinds are a hierarchical list of identifiers separated by ., e.g. "refactor.extract.function".

member.name: F:LanguageServer.Contracts.CodeActionKind.Empty
member.summary: Empty kind.

member.name: F:LanguageServer.Contracts.CodeActionKind.QuickFix
member.summary: Base kind for quickfix actions: "quickfix".

member.name: F:LanguageServer.Contracts.CodeActionKind.Refactor
member.summary: Base kind for refactoring actions: "refactor".

member.name: F:LanguageServer.Contracts.CodeActionKind.RefactorExtract
member.summary:
Base kind for refactoring extraction actions: "refactor.extract".
Example extract actions:
- Extract method - Extract function - Extract variable - Extract interface from class - ...

member.name: F:LanguageServer.Contracts.CodeActionKind.RefactorInline
member.summary:
Base kind for refactoring inline actions: "refactor.inline".
Example inline actions:
- Inline function - Inline variable - Inline constant - ...

member.name: F:LanguageServer.Contracts.CodeActionKind.RefactorRewrite
member.summary:
Base kind for refactoring rewrite actions: "refactor.rewrite".
Example rewrite actions:
- Convert JavaScript function to class - Add or remove parameter - Encapsulate field - Make method static - Move method to base class - ...

member.name: F:LanguageServer.Contracts.CodeActionKind.Source
member.summary:
Base kind for source actions: `source`.
Source code actions apply to the entire file.

member.name: F:LanguageServer.Contracts.CodeActionKind.SourceOrganizeImports
member.summary: Base kind for an organize imports source action: `source.organizeImports`.

member.name: T:LanguageServer.Contracts.CodeActionContext
member.summary: Contains additional diagnostic information about the context in which a code action is run.

member.name: P:LanguageServer.Contracts.CodeActionContext.Diagnostics
member.summary: An array of diagnostics.

member.name: T:LanguageServer.Contracts.CodeLens
member.summary: A code lens represents a command that should be shown along with source text, like the number of references, a way to run tests, etc.

member.name: P:LanguageServer.Contracts.CodeLens.Range
member.summary: The range in which this code lens is valid. Should only span a single line.

member.name: P:LanguageServer.Contracts.CodeLens.Command
member.summary: The command this code lens represents.
member.remarks: A code lens is "unresolved" when no command is associated to it. For performance reasons the creation of a code lens and resolving should be done in two stages.

member.name: P:LanguageServer.Contracts.CodeLens.Data
member.summary: A data entry field that is preserved on a code lens item between a code lens and a code lens resolve request.

member.name: T:LanguageServer.Contracts.CodeLensRegistrationOptions
member.summary: Describe options to be used when registered for code lens events.

member.name: P:LanguageServer.Contracts.CodeLensRegistrationOptions.ResolveProvider
member.summary: Code lens has a resolve provider as well.

member.name: T:LanguageServer.Contracts.Command
member.summary: Use instead of this class.

member.summary: Arguments that the command handler should be invoked with.

member.name: P:LanguageServer.Contracts.EditorCommand.Command
member.summary: The identifier of the actual command handler.

member.name: P:LanguageServer.Contracts.EditorCommand.Title
member.summary: Title of the command, like `save`.

member.summary: Execute command registration options.

member.name: P:LanguageServer.Contracts.ExecuteCommandRegistrationOptions.Commands
member.summary: The commands to be executed on the server.

member.name: T:LanguageServer.Contracts.CompletionItemKind
member.summary: The kind of a completion entry.

member.name: T:LanguageServer.Contracts.InsertTextFormat
member.summary: Defines whether the insert text in a completion item should be interpreted as plain text or a snippet.

member.name: F:LanguageServer.Contracts.InsertTextFormat.PlainText
member.summary: The primary text to be inserted is treated as a plain string.

member.name: F:LanguageServer.Contracts.InsertTextFormat.Snippet
member.summary: The primary text to be inserted is treated as a snippet.

remarks.para: A snippet can define tab stops and placeholders with $1, $2 and ${3:foo}. $0 defines the final tab stop, it defaults to the end of the snippet.Placeholders with equal identifiers are linked, that is typing in one will update others too.

member.name: T:LanguageServer.Contracts.CompletionList
member.summary: Represents a collection of to be presented in the editor。

member.name: P:LanguageServer.Contracts.CompletionList.IsIncomplete
member.summary: This list it not complete. Further typing should result in recomputing this list.

member.name: P:LanguageServer.Contracts.CompletionList.Items
member.summary: The completion items.

member.name: T:LanguageServer.Contracts.CompletionItem
member.summary: A completion item.

member.name: P:LanguageServer.Contracts.CompletionItem.Label
member.summary: The label of this completion item. By default also the text that is inserted when selecting this completion.

member.name: P:LanguageServer.Contracts.CompletionItem.Kind
member.summary: The kind of this completion item. Based of the kind an icon is chosen by the editor.

member.name: P:LanguageServer.Contracts.CompletionItem.Detail
member.summary: A human-readable (short) string with additional information about this item, like type or symbol information.

member.name: P:LanguageServer.Contracts.CompletionItem.Documentation
member.summary: A human-readable string that represents a doc-comment.

member.name: P:LanguageServer.Contracts.CompletionItem.SortText
member.summary: A string that should be used when comparing this item with other items. When `falsy` the label is used.

member.name: P:LanguageServer.Contracts.CompletionItem.FilterText
member.summary: A string that should be used when filtering a set of completion items. When `falsy` the label is used.

member.name: P:LanguageServer.Contracts.CompletionItem.InsertText
member.summary: A string that should be inserted a document when selecting this completion. When `falsy` the label is used.

member.name: P:LanguageServer.Contracts.CompletionItem.InsertTextFormat
member.summary: The format of the insert text. The format applies to both the `insertText` property and the `newText` property of a provided `textEdit`.

member.name: P:LanguageServer.Contracts.CompletionItem.TextEdit
member.summary:
An edit which is applied to a document when selecting this completion. When an edit is provided the value of `insertText` is ignored.
*Note:* The range of the edit must be a single line range and it must contain the position at which completion has been requested.

member.name: P:LanguageServer.Contracts.CompletionItem.AdditionalTextEdits
member.summary: An optional array of additional text edits that are applied when selecting this completion. Edits must not overlap with the main edit nor with themselves.

member.name: P:LanguageServer.Contracts.CompletionItem.CommitCharacters
member.summary: An optional set of characters that when pressed while this completion is active will accept it first and then type that character.

member.name: P:LanguageServer.Contracts.CompletionItem.Command
member.summary: An optional command that is executed *after* inserting this completion. *Note* that additional modifications to the current document should be described with the property.

member.name: P:LanguageServer.Contracts.CompletionItem.Data
member.summary: An data entry field that is preserved on a completion item between a completion and a completion resolve request.

member.name: T:LanguageServer.Contracts.CompletionRegistrationOptions
member.summary: Descibe options to be used when registered for code completion events.

member.name: P:LanguageServer.Contracts.CompletionRegistrationOptions.ResolveProvider
member.summary: The server provides support to resolve additional information for a completion item. (i.e. supports completionItem/resolve.)

member.name: P:LanguageServer.Contracts.CompletionRegistrationOptions.TriggerCharacters
member.summary: The characters that trigger completion automatically.

member.name: T:LanguageServer.Contracts.CompletionContext
member.summary: Contains additional information about the context in which a completion request is triggered.
member.remarks: When used to implement textDocument/completion, this instance is only available if the client specifies to send this using ClientCapabilities.TextDocument.Completion.ContextSupport == true.

member.summary: Client supports commit on a completion item.

member.name: P:LanguageServer.Contracts.TextDocumentCompletionItemCapability.DocumentationFormat
member.summary: Client supports the follow content formats for the documentation property.The order describes the preferred format of the client.

member.name: P:LanguageServer.Contracts.TextDocumentCompletionItemKindCapability.ValueSet
member.summary: The completion item kind values the client supports. When this property exists the client also guarantees that it will handle values outside its set gracefully and falls back to a default value when unknown.
member.remarks: If this property is not present, the client only supports the completion items kinds from `Text` to `Reference` as defined in the initial version of the protocol.

member.name: T:LanguageServer.Contracts.TextDocumentHoverCapability
member.summary: Capabilities specific to the `textDocument/hover`.

member.name: P:LanguageServer.Contracts.TextDocumentHoverCapability.ContentFormat
member.summary: Client supports the follow content formats for the content property. The order describes the preferred format of the client.

member.name: T:LanguageServer.Contracts.TextDocumentSignatureHelpCapability
member.summary: Capabilities specific to the `textDocument/signatureHelp`.

member.name: P:LanguageServer.Contracts.TextDocumentSignatureHelpCapability.SignatureInformation
member.summary: The client supports the following specific properties.

member.name: P:LanguageServer.Contracts.TextDocumentSignatureInformationCapability.DocumentationFormat
member.summary: Client supports the follow content formats for the documentation property. The order describes the preferred format of the client.

member.name: P:LanguageServer.Contracts.DocumentLinkClientCapabilities.TooltipSupport
member.summary: Whether the client supports the `tooltip` property on `DocumentLink`. (LSP 3.15)

member.name: P:LanguageServer.Contracts.FoldingRangeClientCapabilities.RangeLimit
member.summary: The maximum number of folding ranges that the client prefers to receive per document. The value serves as a hint, servers are free to follow the limit.

member.name: P:LanguageServer.Contracts.FoldingRangeClientCapabilities.LineFoldingOnly
member.summary: If set, the client signals that it only supports folding complete lines. If set, client will ignore specified `startCharacter` and `endCharacter` properties in a FoldingRange.

member.name: P:LanguageServer.Contracts.WindowClientCapability.WorkDoneProgress
member.summary: Whether client supports handling progress notifications.

member.name: T:LanguageServer.Contracts.InitializeResult
member.summary: The response for initialize request.

member.name: P:LanguageServer.Contracts.InitializeResult.Capabilities
member.summary: The capabilities the language server provides.

member.name: T:LanguageServer.Contracts.InitializeError
member.summary: The error response for initialize request. (Set this object to .)

member.name: P:LanguageServer.Contracts.InitializeError.Retry
member.summary: Indicates whether the client execute the retry logic as described in the "remarks" section.
member.remarks:
The retry logic is as follows:
show the message provided by the ResponseError to the user
user selects retry or cancel
if user selected retry the initialize method is sent again.

member.name: T:LanguageServer.Contracts.TextDocumentSyncKind
member.summary: Defines how the host (editor) should sync document changes to the language server.

member.name: F:LanguageServer.Contracts.TextDocumentSyncKind.None
member.summary: Documents should not be synced at all.

member.name: F:LanguageServer.Contracts.TextDocumentSyncKind.Full
member.summary: Documents are synced by always sending the full content of the document.

member.name: F:LanguageServer.Contracts.TextDocumentSyncKind.Incremental
member.summary: Documents are synced by sending the full content on open. After that only incremental updates to the document are send.

member.name: P:LanguageServer.Contracts.TextDocumentSyncOptions.OpenClose
member.summary: Open and close notifications are sent to the server.

member.name: P:LanguageServer.Contracts.TextDocumentSyncOptions.Change
member.summary: Change notifications are sent to the server. See TextDocumentSyncKind.None, TextDocumentSyncKind.Full and TextDocumentSyncKind.Incremental.

member.name: P:LanguageServer.Contracts.TextDocumentSyncOptions.WillSave
member.summary: Will save notifications are sent to the server.

member.name: P:LanguageServer.Contracts.TextDocumentSyncOptions.WillSaveWaitUntil
member.summary: Will save wait until requests are sent to the server.

member.summary: Save notifications are sent to the server.

member.summary: Whether the server has support for workspace folders.

member.name: P:LanguageServer.Contracts.WorkspaceFoldersServerCapabilities.ChangeNotificationId
member.summary: (changeNotifications) When specified, indicates the server wants to receive workspace folder change notifications.
member.value: null to indicate the server does not want to receive workspace folder change notifications. Or a string containing an ID under which the notification is registered on the client side. The ID can be used to unregister for these events using the client/unregisterCapability request ().

member.name: T:LanguageServer.Contracts.LanguageServiceParameterValueConverter
member.summary: A implementation that is supposed to be used with LSP over JSON-RPC.

member.name: T:LanguageServer.Contracts.Location
member.summary: Represents a location inside a resource, such as a line inside a text file.

member.name: T:LanguageServer.Contracts.Range
member.summary: A range in a text document expressed as (zero-based) start and end positions. A range is comparable to a selection in an editor. Therefore the end position is exclusive.

member.name: T:LanguageServer.Contracts.Position
member.summary: Position in a text document expressed as zero-based line and character offset. A position is between two characters like an 'insert' cursor in a editor.

member.name: T:LanguageServer.Contracts.MarkupContent
member.summary: A `MarkupContent` literal represents a string value which content is interpreted base on its kind flag. Currently the protocol supports plaintext and markdown as markup kinds. If the kind is `markdown` then the value can contain fenced code blocks like in GitHub issues. See https://help.github.com/articles/creating-and-highlighting-code-blocks/#syntax-highlighting.

member.name: M:LanguageServer.Contracts.MarkupContent.PlainText(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a with plaintext content.

member.name: M:LanguageServer.Contracts.MarkupContent.Markdown(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a with markdown content.

member.name: M:LanguageServer.Contracts.MarkupContent.MarkedString(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a with a code snippet in the given language. This is equivalent to the deprecated MarkedString.
member.param: the code language.
the code.

remarks.para: MarkedString can be used to render human readable text. It is either a markdown string or a code-block that provides a language and a code snippet. The language identifier is semantically equal to the optional language identifier in fenced code blocks in GitHub issues. See https://help.github.com/articles/creating-and-highlighting-code-blocks/#syntax-highlighting
We still keep this overload in LanguageServer.NET in order to facilitate the code snippet construction.

member.name: P:LanguageServer.Contracts.MarkupContent.Kind
member.summary: The type of the Markup.

member.name: P:LanguageServer.Contracts.MarkupContent.Value
member.summary: The content itself.

member.summary: Implicitly converts string into with .

member.summary: Describes the content type that a client supports in various result literals like , or .
member.remarks: Please note that must not start with a $. This kinds are reserved for internal usage.

member.name: T:LanguageServer.Contracts.SignatureHelp
member.summary: Signature help represents the signature of something callable.There can be multiple signature but only one active and only one active parameter.

member.name: P:LanguageServer.Contracts.SignatureHelp.Signatures
member.summary: One or more signatures.

member.name: P:LanguageServer.Contracts.SignatureHelp.ActiveSignature
member.summary: The active signature. If omitted or the value lies outside the range of `signatures` the value defaults to zero or is ignored if `signatures.length === 0`. Whenever possible implementors should make an active decision about the active signature and shouldn't rely on a default value. In future version of the protocol this property might become mandatory to better express this.

member.name: P:LanguageServer.Contracts.SignatureHelp.ActiveParameter
member.summary: The active parameter of the active signature. If omitted or the value lies outside the range of `signatures[activeSignature].parameters` defaults to 0 if the active signature has parameters. If the active signature has no parameters it is ignored. In future version of the protocol this property might become mandatory to better express the active parameter if the active signature does have any.

member.name: T:LanguageServer.Contracts.SignatureInformation
member.summary: Represents the signature of something callable.A signature can have a label, like a function-name, a doc-comment, and a set of parameters.

member.name: P:LanguageServer.Contracts.SignatureInformation.Label
member.summary: The label of this signature. Will be shown in the UI.

member.name: P:LanguageServer.Contracts.SignatureInformation.Documentation
member.summary: The human-readable doc-comment of this signature. Will be shown in the UI but can be omitted.

member.name: P:LanguageServer.Contracts.SignatureInformation.Parameters
member.summary: The parameters of this signature.

member.name: T:LanguageServer.Contracts.ParameterInformation
member.summary: Represents a parameter of a callable-signature.A parameter can have a label and a doc-comment.

member.name: P:LanguageServer.Contracts.ParameterInformation.Label
member.summary: The label of this parameter. Will be shown in the UI.

member.name: P:LanguageServer.Contracts.ParameterInformation.Documentation
member.summary: The human-readable doc-comment of this parameter. Will be shown in the UI but can be omitted.

member.summary: Describe options to be used when registered for signature help events.

member.summary: The characters that trigger signature help automatically.

member.summary: Additional information about the context in which a signature help request was triggered. (LSP 3.15)

member.summary: Action that caused signature help to be triggered.

member.summary: Character that caused signature help to be triggered.

member.name: P:LanguageServer.Contracts.SignatureHelpContext.IsRetrigger
member.summary: `true` if signature help was already showing when it was triggered.

member.name: P:LanguageServer.Contracts.SignatureHelpContext.ActiveSignatureHelp
member.summary: The currently active `SignatureHelp`.

member.summary: An identifier to denote a specific version of a text document.

member.name: T:LanguageServer.Contracts.TextDocumentContentChangeEvent
member.summary: An event describing a change to a text document. If range and rangeLength are omitted, the new text is considered to be the full content of the document.

member.name: P:LanguageServer.Contracts.TextDocumentContentChangeEvent.Range
member.summary: The range of the document that changed.

member.name: P:LanguageServer.Contracts.TextDocumentContentChangeEvent.RangeLength
member.summary: The length of the range (text length) that got replaced.

member.name: P:LanguageServer.Contracts.TextDocumentContentChangeEvent.HasRange
member.summary: Gets/sets whether both and are available.

member.name: P:LanguageServer.Contracts.TextDocumentContentChangeEvent.Text
member.summary: The new text of the range/document.
member.remarks: If and are omitted, the new text is considered to be the full content of the document.

member.summary: Descibe options to be used when registered for text document change events.

member.summary: Represents reasons why a text document is saved. (In textDocument/willSave.)

member.name: F:LanguageServer.Contracts.TextDocumentSaveReason.Manual
member.summary: Manually triggered, e.g. by the user pressing save, by starting debugging, or by an API call.

member.name: F:LanguageServer.Contracts.TextDocumentSaveReason.AfterDelay
member.summary: Automatic after a delay.

member.summary: When the editor lost focus.

member.name: T:LanguageServer.Contracts.TextDocumentSaveRegistrationOptions
member.summary: Descibe options to be used when registered for text document save events.

member.name: T:LanguageServer.Contracts.TextEdit
member.summary: A textual edit operation applicable to a text document.

member.name: P:LanguageServer.Contracts.TextEdit.Range
member.summary: The range of the text document to be manipulated. To insert text into a document create a range where start === end.

member.name: P:LanguageServer.Contracts.TextEdit.NewText
member.summary: The string to be inserted.For delete operations use an empty string.

member.name: T:LanguageServer.Contracts.TextDocumentEdit
member.summary: Describes textual changes on a single text document. The text document is referred to as a to allow clients to check the text document version before an edit is applied.

member.name: P:LanguageServer.Contracts.TextDocumentEdit.TextDocument
member.summary: The text document to change.

member.name: P:LanguageServer.Contracts.TextDocumentEdit.Edits
member.summary: The edits to be applied.

member.name: T:LanguageServer.Contracts.WorkspaceEdit
member.summary: A workspace edit represents changes to many resources managed in the workspace. The edit should either provide changes or documentChanges. If are present they are preferred over if the client can handle versioned document edits.

member.name: P:LanguageServer.Contracts.WorkspaceEdit.Changes
member.summary: Holds changes to existing resources.

member.name: P:LanguageServer.Contracts.WorkspaceEdit.DocumentChanges
member.summary: An array of `TextDocumentEdit`s to express changes to specific a specific version of a text document. Whether a client supports versioned document edits is expressed via `WorkspaceClientCapabilities.versionedWorkspaceEdit`.

member.name: P:LanguageServer.Contracts.WorkDoneProgress.Message
member.summary: Optional, more detailed associated progress message. Contains complementary information to the `title`.

member.name: P:LanguageServer.Contracts.WorkDoneProgressBegin.Title
member.summary: Mandatory title of the progress operation. Used to briefly inform about the kind of operation being performed. (Examples: "Indexing" or "Linking dependencies".)

member.name: P:LanguageServer.Contracts.WorkDoneProgressBegin.Cancellable
member.summary: Controls enablement state of a cancel button. This property is only valid if a cancel button got requested in the `WorkDoneProgressStart` payload.
member.remarks: Clients that don't support cancellation or don't support control the button's enablement state are allowed to ignore the setting.

member.name: P:LanguageServer.Contracts.WorkDoneProgressBegin.Percentage
member.summary: Optional progress percentage to display (value 100 is considered 100%). If not provided infinite progress is assumed and clients are allowed to ignore the value in subsequent in report notifications.

member.name: P:LanguageServer.Contracts.WorkDoneProgressReport.Cancellable
member.summary: Controls enablement state of a cancel button. This property is only valid if a cancel button got requested in the `WorkDoneProgressStart` payload.
member.remarks: Clients that don't support cancellation or don't support control the button's enablement state are allowed to ignore the setting.

member.name: P:LanguageServer.Contracts.WorkDoneProgressReport.Percentage
member.summary: Optional progress percentage to display (value 100 is considered 100%). If not provided infinite progress is assumed and clients are allowed to ignore the value in subsequent in report notifications.
member.remarks: he value should be steadily rising. Clients are free to ignore values hat are not following this rule.

member.name: T:LanguageServer.Contracts.ProgressToken
member.summary: Represents a , or value indicating a token used to report progress.

member.summary: Determines whether the specified document URI indeicates an "untitled" document.
member.remarks: The URI of an untitled document has the following structure: untitled:xxxxx.
